p: Reactive species may be produced in physiological conditions, through aerobic metabolism and macrophage activation, or in pathological states following exposure to xenobiotics, such as toxins, pollutants, cigarettes pesticides, or radiation. To counterbalance oxidative stress, phytochemicals with antioxidant activity found in foods such as fruits, vegetables, cereals, and tubers, are noteworthy as a relevant diet intervention topic. Evaluating the total antioxidant capacity (TAC) of foods is useful to improve functional diet quality and assist in health maintenance [ 67, 68].
